title: @Riot While you're updating Universe with Swain's release don't forget to move Evelynn off the Isles

embed.description: The land now known as the Shadow Isles was once a beautiful realm, but it was shattered by a magical cataclysm. Black Mist permanently shrouds the isles and the land itself is tainted, corrupted by malevolent sorcery. Living beings that stand upon the Shadow Isles slowly have their life-force leeched from them, which, in turn, draws the insatiable, predatory spirits of the dead.

body:
Evelynn used to (kinda) be a part of the Shadow Isles before the lore update and even though it says Runeterra under her portrait on Universe's site, she still pops up if you search the Isles. My friend who is just getting back into the lore because he's hyped for Noxus said I lied to him and deceived him telling him Evelynn wasn't a weird vampire undead thing anymore, pls take my side Rito.

Side note, hyped as hell for that Swain and hopefully Noxus lore.

replies.body: Could you also add "Make 10+ short stories about Orianna's lore" to their list of things to do also? :D

Hopefully one of them will let her put on a display that will actually feel like she's a champion. Her current short story *is* very cute, but thwacking two guards and running away hardly constitutes a feat in terms of League characters.

Does completely replacing one's own body with clockwork by hand after sacrificing your own health for a child's count?
Cause that's a pretty legendary feat.

I'd agree if not for the fact that her father had as much of a hand in her metamorphosis as she did, if not more. He was the one who changed her body into machinery as it became sick, with her help when she could.

Also, not sure if you're referencing old lore, but new lore Orianna didn't do it for a child's sake but for her own, though she gave her heart to her sick father.

She did most of it on her own.

And actually her lore has her go down to Zaun to help after an really bad gas leak by handing out masks.  She ran out and found one last child without one.  She immediately took hers off and put it on the kid, the gas destroyed her lungs necessitating the first replacement done by her father.  She kept replacing more and more until she only had her original heart left, which also held her humanity.  She gave it to her ailing father and replaced it with a hextech core, simultaneously freeing herself from needing to be wound up by him and saving his life.
She also made hundreds of little figurines for him to sell and retire one.

And you're right, her father helped with some of it but she did large parts too.

I'd have to re-read it, but i do believe her father did most of the work. Cutting yourself open and prying out your own lungs to then replace them with a very complex mechanism seems like something that would take a long time, and something that would have killed her had she tried. For limbs, sure why not. The heart, as it was basically the last piece of her human body, sure. Her brains? I don't think it's doable alone.

I'll make the bet she was unconscious for most of the major changes.

I did forget how she'd gotten sick in the first place though, good catch.

Back to the initial point though, while Orianna's fabrication counts as one of the more outstanding Champion origin stories, her short story about the monkey left me a bit perplex. Was this all a clockwork machine powered by a hextech core could do? Struggling against two circus guards doesn't seem very... champion-y.

The story was nice and the interaction between Orianna and the monkey was neat as well as doing a good job of showcasing her mindset, but i'd have written Orianna dispatching those guards with ease, unlike what they did.

Well she's not a combatant.  She was never trained in battle, she has no tactical knowledge, and her body isn't made for combat.  She has perfect command over her robot yes, but it was built for  defense, and to search for survivors in wreckage.  The reason she doesn't dispatch the gaurds is because it's not in her nature.  Orianna is a supporter, who's first action after losing her humanity was giving this man she no longer even seed as her father a retirement plan and a momento of the daughter he had lost.  And again her robot is designed simply to defend her not kill, she wouldn't even know how to use it as a proper weapon.
I never realized I needed that until you pointed that out; it’d be really neat to see what she can do in an actually dangerous situation.

_R A V A G E_

_T H R O W_
